reporter_caption.center: TOMPKINS v. HOULTON BAND OF MALISEET INDIANS, 515 A.2d 744 (Me. 1986)

caption.center: Joyce TOMPKINS v. HOULTON BAND OF MALISEET INDIANS.

opinion.posture: Appeal from the Superior Court Aroostook County.
opinion.attorneys:
Michael Carpenter (orally), Wells, Carpenter Hunt, Houlton, for plaintiff.
Malcolm Berman (orally), Houlton, for defendant.
opinion.panel: Before McKUSICK, C.J., and NICHOLS, ROBERTS, WATHEN, GLASSMAN, SCOLNIK and CLIFFORD, JJ.
opinion.opinion_text:
MEMORANDUM OF DECISION.
The defendant's appeal from the denial of its motion to dismiss for lack of proper service of process is premature. See Garrisonv. Finks, 469 A.2d 440 (Me. 1983); Hazzard v. West View GolfClub, Inc., 217 A.2d 217, 222 (Me. 1966).
The entry is:
Appeal dismissed.
All concurring.Page 745
